Try FlightAPI for Free Let's talk Compare prices from multiple vendors Live Plane Tracking Accurate Airport Schedule Flight Price API With our Flight Search API you can search and track flight prices from multiple vendors. You can track prices for oneway, round and even multi city trips. You can even select your currency in which you would like to see the results. API is fast and flexible. Learn More Flight Tracking API With this Flights API you get accurate information for a flight departure and arrival. Information like time of departure and arrival, date, terminal and current status. This airline API accepts IATA codes. Learn More Airport Schedule API This Airport API will provide complete schedule of an airport from last two days to three days in advance. This is a data rich API which is comprised of every little detail from corrdinates to elevation. Learn More Contact us about yourproject Start a conversation Flexible & Easier to implement. FlightAPI is a top-performing Flights API provider with 8000+ clients and it is the fastest and the most flexible Flight Data API. Integration just takes a minute, with just a signle GET request you get data in JSON form. With our data rich aviation APIs you can create several apps like real-time flight tracking or if you have a flight booking website then you this API to track your niche market for competitive advantage over pricing. Data Source A large part of our data is sourced from aviation industry and airport authorities itself. This help us to keep data fresh and upto date. We have also partnered with several industry leads for data source. Pocket friendly Flight API provides free 50 API calls for the new users and then you can choose any plan from LITE to PLUS according to your needs. LITE plan starts from $49 per month in which you get 30000 API calls for a month. You are free to cancel your subscription anytime. Got queries? We've got answers! What is FlightAPI? FlightAPI provides flight prices for any route from more than 700 airlines and vendors. It also provide airport schedule and live airplane tracking. Can I try the API for free on your website? Yes, you can just signup and start testing it for free. Which payment methods are supported? We only accept payments through cards. Is there support for multi-city or complex itineraries? Yes we have a multi-city API as well. Can I cancel my plan any time? Yes, you can cancel your subscription at any time without any cancellation fees. Can I book flights using this API? NO. You cannot book flights using our API. This API only tracks prices. Terms and Privacy Policy Service Level Agreement About Us Hotel API FlightAPI 2023 Questions for our sales team? nodes.description: Identify potential online sources for flight data between Delhi and Tokyo, including airline websites, travel aggregators, and aviation databases.
nodes.agent_prompt: Find and list at least 5 potential online sources (websites, APIs, databases) that provide flight data between Delhi (DEL) and Tokyo (TYO), including details such as airlines, flight schedules, prices, and historical data.

nodes.description: Analyze the identified sources to determine the data fields available, data formats, and access methods (e.g., API, web scraping).
nodes.agent_prompt: Analyze the list of flight data sources from T001 and identify the key data fields available in each source (e.g., flight number, departure time, arrival time, price, airline). Also, determine the format of the data and the access methods (e.g., API, web scraping). Output a table summarizing the findings.

nodes.description: Create a Python script to simulate fetching flight data from one or more of the identified sources, focusing on key fields like flight number, departure time, arrival time, and price.
nodes.agent_prompt: Write a Python script that simulates fetching flight data for flights between Delhi (DEL) and Tokyo (TYO). Simulate retrieving data for at least 5 different flights. The script should generate a JSON formatted output including the following fields: flight_number, departure_time, arrival_time, price, airline. Store the simulated data in a list of dictionaries. Include a placeholder comment for future extension to read a CSV. Please also leave comments on how this script could be adapted to read from a real API or scrape a website.

nodes.description: Analyze the simulated flight data to identify trends, patterns, or anomalies in flight schedules and prices.
nodes.agent_prompt: Analyze the simulated flight data generated by T003. Identify any trends or patterns in flight schedules (e.g., most common departure times) and prices (e.g., average price, price range). Identify anomalies such as unusually high or low prices. Output a summary of the findings.

nodes.description: Generate a comprehensive report summarizing the flight data analysis, including data sources, methodology, key findings, and limitations.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Create a comprehensive report in markdown format that summarizes the flight data analysis. The report should include:

1.  A section describing the identified data sources (from T001 and T002) and the methodology used to simulate data retrieval (from T003).
2.  A section presenting the key findings from the flight data analysis (from T004), including trends, patterns, and anomalies.
3.  A section discussing the limitations of the analysis, such as the use of simulated data and the limited scope of the data sources. Include code snippets from T003 in an appendix.
